Privacy Policy


Last Updated: 25 July 2018


At BTCFX we care about our customers and value your privacy which is why we strive to keep your personal information safe This privacy policy has been compiled to describe how your personal data is being collected, used, protected and shared when you visit BTCFX online or make investment “https://btcfx.io”

Reference in this policy to “BTCFX”, “we”, “us”, “our” or any similar term is to BTCFX, who is the data controller and can be contacted via email support@btcfx.io

This privacy policy will explain to you:

  • How we collect personal data
  • The data & personal information we collect
  • How we use your personal data
  • How we use cookies
  • How we share your personal data
  • How we share your data to third party service providers
  • Security of your personal data
  • With additional information about your data

How we collect personal data

When you use of service of create an account with BTCFX, communicate with us, we may collect your personal data. At BTCFX, we do this in various ways, which are;

  • when you sign up for a BTCFX account
  • When you invest or take part in surveys and promotions
  • when you communicate with us by email, telephone, chat, or any other means, we collect the communication and any data provided in it;
  • when you use the BTCFX bitcoin investment platform we collect information on your investments, verification & withdraws;
  • when we obtain information from third parties such as identity verification services, credit reference agencies, and regulatory and enforcement agencies.

The data & personal information we Collect

When you sign up with us, we collect your personal information such as;

  • Name
  • Email Address
  • Phone Number

When you verify your account we collect information

  • Country
  • Phone number
  • City
  • Address
  • Date of birth

When you communicate with our support team or take part in our customer and market survey, we collect your email address We also collect data using first party cookies which helps us collect data automatically when you browse the BTCFX website, we collect data such as how you arrived on our site, how you are interacting on the website, issues you having our website, the location from which you are visiting our website and what device you are using to browse our website.

How we use your personal data

At BTCFX, we use your personal data for one or more of the following purposes;

  • In verifying your identity in accordance with Know Your Customer (KYC)
  • In the management and maintainance of your account with us;
  • In monitoring and preventing fraudulent or unauthorised use of our services
  • To provide you with everytime better customer support
  • To improve your business relationship with us
  • For notification of about benefits and updates of the features of our products and services;
  • To serve you with personalised advertising and marketing;
  • To respond to your enquiries and to resolve issues.
  • Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and sanctions screening requirements;

Where necessary to protect our legal rights and interest, or the interests of others, we also use personal data in relation to legal claims, compliance, audit, risk management and regulatory functions. We may also use personal data in connection with the acquisition, merger or sale of a business.

How we use Cookies

On our website, we also collect personal data through the use of cookies. Cookies (and other similar technologies) help us give you the best experience of using the BTCFX website. “Cookies” are data files that are placed on your device or computer and often include an anonymous unique identifier.

We use both session and persistent cookies. Session cookies are deleted when you close down your browser (chrome, safari, explorer, while persistent cookies remain on your device until they expire or you delete them. Persistent cookies allow us to remember things about you when you visit our website again.

“Log files” track actions occurring on the Site, and collect data including your IP address, browser type, Internet service provider, referring/exit pages, and date/time stamps.

“Web beacons,” “tags,” and “pixels” are electronic files used to record information about how you browse the Site. Cookies allow us to remember your actions or preferences over time. Browsing our website, we use this cookies to collect data that helps us to:

  • Track site usage and browsing behaviour
  • Allow you to sign in to your account and browse our website;
  • In monitoring and preventing fraudulent or unauthorised use of our services
  • Personalize our website’s functionality and improve your experience
  • Improve how our website and UX to serve you better
  • Allow third parties to provide optimization services to our website;
  • Track, monitor & optimize the effectiveness of our marketing efforts
  • Personalize our ads and promotion when you visit third party websites
  • Enhance security, resolve website errors and help prevent fraudulent activities.

Third Party Cookies

We may provide data about your visit to our website to analytics, search engine providers, advertisement providers to help us improve and optimize our services and marketing efforts. We generally only share this information in a form that does not directly identify you, by using behavioural information, such as how you navigate the internet, to provide relevant advertisements to you.

We also use tracking pixels, which help us collect and store information about your visits to our website, such as which webpages you viewed and interacted with, time spent on our website, other thinks you did on the website, as well as the specific advertisement that appealed you. No PII “personally identifiable information: is stored on these cookies. The information reported to us is aggregated and anonymous. We use this information to understand

  • The effectiveness of our advertising, promotions and marketing
  • Track events and conversions on our website
  • Personalize our marketing experience for you

Overall, cookies, tags and pixels help us provide you with a better website and marketing experience, by enabling us to understand your behaviour on our website. A cookie in no way gives us access to your computer or any information about you, other than the data you choose to share with us. We may provide your personal data to our professional advisors (like lawyers, accountants, and financial advisors) if needed for our own professional advice or guidance.

We may provide your personal data to law enforcement or regulatory authorities if required under law. By you signing up for an account with BTCFX, or continuing to use our website or you investing with our company, you agree to our use of cookies as set out in this policy. You may decline our cookies if your browser or browser add-on permits, but doing so may interfere with your use of BTCFX's services. For more information on what a cookie is or how to delete or reject cookies

https://support.apple.com/en-ng/guide/safari/manage-cookies-and-website-data-sfri11471/mac
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/17442/windows-internet-explorer-delete-manage-cookies
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enable-and-disable-cookies-website-preferences
https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647

Third-party links

We do not include or offer third-party products or services on our website.

How we share your data with third party service providers

We share your data anonymously with third party service provider to help us improve customer experience and serve you with personalized ads and promotions

Third Party we use

Google Analytics

Google Analytics is a web analytics service offered by Google that tracks and reports website traffic. Google uses the data collected to track and monitor the use of our Service. This data is shared with other Google services. Google may use the collected data to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network.

You can opt-out by clicking here. This opt-out prevents Google Analytics JavaScript (ga.js, analytics.js, and dc.js) from sharing information with Google Analytics about your visit to our website, which is against our preferences.{" "}

Google Ads

We uses the Google advertisement and remarketing services to advertise on third party websites (including Google) to previous visitors to our site. It could mean that we advertise to previous visitors who haven’t completed a task on our site, for example using the contact form to make an enquiry. This could be in the form of an advertisement on the Google search results page, or a site in the Google Display Network. Third-party vendors, including Google, use cookies to serve ads based on someone’s past visits. Of course, any data collected will be used in accordance with our own privacy policy and Google’s privacy policy. You can set preferences for how Google advertises to you using the Google Ad Preferences page, and if you want to you can opt out of interest-based advertising entirely by cookie settings or permanently using a browser plugin.

Google’s Ads requirements can be summed up by Google’s Advertising Principles. They are put in place to provide a positive experience for users.{" "} https://support.google.com/adwordspolicy/answer/1316548?hl=en

We have not enabled Google AdSense on our site

Facebook Ads

We use Facebook Ads and retargeting services to serve you with more personalized ads and also to understand how your interact with our websites, Facebook pixels, also help us track, monitor and optimze conversions such as sign up, contact form submit, website issues, the webpages you visit on the BTCFX website, you can optout from this pixel by visiting{" "} https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=ads , but this against our preferences and you can read up on their advertising policy on{" "} https://www.facebook.com/policies/ads/

Quora Ads

We use Quora advertisement and tracking pixel to help us track, monitor and optimze conversions such as sign up, contact form submit, website issues, the webpages you visit on the BTCFX website, you can optout from this pixel by visiting{" "} https://www.quora.com/optout , but this against our preferencesand also read about their advertising policies{" "} https://www.quora.com/about/ads_policy

Security of your personal data

We use Reddit advertisement and tracking pixel to help us track, monitor and optimze conversions such as sign up, contact form submit, website issues, the webpages you visit on the BTCFX website, you can optout from this pixel by visiting your browser settings, but this against our preferencesand also read about their advertising policies{" "} https://www.reddithelp.com/en/categories/advertising/policy-guidelines/reddit-advertising-policy

BTCFX places great importance on customer seurity by ensuring the security of your personal data. We regularly review and implement up-to-date technical and organisational security measures when processing your personal data. Cyber security department of BTCFX are trained to handle personal data securely and with the utmost respect, failing which they may be subject to disciplinary action. Our website is scanned on a regular basis for security holes and known vulnerabilities in order to make your visit to our site as safe as possible. We use regular Malware Scanning, Your personal data is contained behind secured networks and is only accessible by a limited number of persons who have special access rights to such systems, and are required to keep the personal data confidential. In addition, all sensitive/credit information you supply is encrypted via Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology. We implement a variety of security measures when a user enters, submits, or accesses their personal data to maintain the safety of your personal data. All transactions are processed through a gateway provider and are not stored or processed on our servers. We may transfer, store or process your personal data outside of the European Economic Area (“EEA”). The laws in some countries may not provide as much legal protection for your personal data as in the EEA. By submitting your personal data to us, you agree to this transfer, storing or processing. Where we use service providers outside the EEA, we rely on approved data transfer mechanisms (for example, the EU Standard Contractual Clauses and the EU-US Privacy Shield) to ensure that your personal data is adequately safeguarded in the recipient country. Once we have received your personal data, we will use strict procedures and security features to try to prevent unauthorized access.

Other Important information about our privacy policy

DO NOT TRACK

Please note that we do not alter our Site’s data collection and use practices when we see a Do Not Track signal from your browser

Children’s Privacy

COPPA (Children Online Privacy Protection Act)When it comes to the collection of personal information from children and teenagers under 18, the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) puts parents in control. The Federal Trade Commission, the nation’s consumer protection agency, enforces the COPPA Rule, which spells out what operators of websites and online services must do to protect children’s privacy and safety online. Our Services do not address anyone under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal identifiable information from children or teenagers under 18 In the case we discover that a child or teenagers under 18 has provided us with personal information, we immediately delete this from our servers. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us so that we will be able to do necessary actions.

Your Personal Data Retention

We will only retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes we collected it for, including for the purposes of satisfying any legal, accounting, verification, customer satisfaction, preventing fraud, improving security, settling disputes or reporting requirements. To determine the appropriate retention period for personal data, we consider the amount, nature, and sensitivity of the personal data, the potential risk of harm from unauthorized use or disclosure of your personal data, the purposes for which we process your personal data and whether we can achieve those purposes through other means, and the applicable legal requirements. At any time, however, you may contact us to request that we delete all of your personal data.

Incomplete personal data

Where indicated (for example in application forms or account opening forms), it is obligatory to provide your personal data to us to enable us to process your application for our products or services. Should you decline to provide us with such personal data, we may not be able to process your application/request or provide you with our products or services.

Your right to access, update, or remove your personal data

Most of the data we collect, and the ways in which we use it, are necessary for us to provide and improve the services we provide to you, or to comply with our obligations. In certain situations, we give you the ability to choose how we use your data. Depending on the country in which you live, you may have certain rights under data protection law, including the right to object to the processing of your personal data or to request that we: provide you with a copy of your personal data (including in a format that can be shared with a new provider); or correct, delete, or restrict the processing of your personal data. Please submit a support ticket if you would like to exercise any of the above rights. These rights are limited in some situations, such as where we are legally required to process your data, and may limit your ability to use our products and services.

Data breaches

We will notify you and the relevant supervisory authority as soon as we become aware of any data breach that is likely to result in a risk to your rights and freedoms.

Revisions to this Privacy Policy

We may amend this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will do our best to notify you of any amendments to the Privacy Policy and any such notice will be posted on our application or our website, or sent by email to the address associated with your BTCFX account.

Contacting us in relation to personal data

Should you have any query in relation to this Privacy Policy and practices on how we handle your personal data, please contact us by submitting a support ticket using the email support@btcfx.io
